title: GT Recycling expands plastic recycling plant - Waste Management Review
summary: GT Recycling, a family-owned Australian company, has invested in a new plastic recycling line using EREMA's INTAREMA TVEplus 1714 technology. This new line allows them to recycle polypropylene and low-density polyethylene into high-quality pellets for use in manufacturing various plastic products within Australia, helping to reduce plastic waste and promote a circular economy. The company's investment was driven by both environmental concerns and the opportunity to capitalize on the growing demand for recycled plastic materials.

title: Cash for containers program launches - Ocean Grove Voice
summary: Victoria's Container Deposit Scheme (CDS) launched on November 1st, providing residents with a convenient way to recycle cans, bottles, and cartons. The scheme features automated reverse vending machines and over-the-counter refund points, offering 10 cents per item for eligible containers. The aim is to increase recycling rates and reduce litter in the state.

title: A win-win for communities and the environment - The Age
summary: TOMRA Cleanaway, a joint venture between TOMRA and Cleanaway, has launched a new reverse vending system in Victoria, Australia, aimed at maximizing container recycling. The system utilizes automated machines for convenient container return and features partnerships with local charities and organizations, creating new job opportunities while fostering a circular economy.

title: $1.26M boost to Tasmania's plastic recycling capacity - Waste Management Review
summary: The Australian and Tasmanian governments have jointly invested $1.26 million to expand a plastic recycling facility in Tasmania, aiming to divert 1700 tonnes of plastic waste from landfill each year. The upgraded facility will recycle soft and flexible plastic waste into new products for agricultural and industrial sectors, supporting six ongoing jobs and promoting a circular economy in Tasmania. This investment is part of the Australian government's Recycling Modernization Fund, which aims to increase recycling capabilities and create jobs across the country.
product_or_process: Recycling of soft and flexible plastic waste

title: Vic Container Deposit Scheme launches - Waste Management Review
summary: Victoria's Container Deposit Scheme (CDS Vic) has launched, offering a 10-cent refund for returned drink containers. The scheme aims to reduce litter, create jobs, and promote recycling. Retailers like Coles have implemented reverse vending machines in stores, making recycling convenient and rewarding for customers.
